item.title: What Does an AI Know about Arts?
item.description: The artworks by Dutch painter Hieronymus Bosch are well known for their incredible wealth of details. A popular Twitter bot posts small segments of the digitized paintings, thus relieving their density and making them more accessible. My Twitter bot CaptioningBoschBot reacts to these out-of-context image segments and uses them as input for an encoder-decoder model to generate captions that interpret the painted scenes. The encoder-decoder model was trained on photos and realistic pictures and doesn’t possess the vocabulary to analyze art. The resulting captions still reveal curious interpretations of otherworldly details. It uses the out-of-context painting segments as input for an encoder-decoder model to generate captions that interpret the painted objects. The generated captions are again posted on Twitter to encourage discussions about Bosch’s masterpieces and the AI technology in general.
